subject: Gymnastics
lead_paragraph: The American men answered their critics who said they were lucky to qualify for the Beijing Olympics by finishing fourth yesterday at the world gymnastics championships in Stuttgart, Germany. If not for two falls off the high bar, the United States would have been the bronze medalist. China breezed to its third consecutive title — and seventh in the past eight world championships — by an almost 5-point margin. Japan took the silver and Germany the bronze, 1.25 points ahead of the Americans.
